definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: And you know what, the waste you exhale when you smoke is more toxic to cause cancer.
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，你吸菸時呼出的廢氣更加具有致癌性質。
深吸一口氣，現在呼出來，再來一遍。

sentences.english: The way to over come nervousness is to breathe in deep and breathe out slowly for some times.
sentences.chinese: 克服緊張的辦法是調勻呼吸，深吸氣，慢呼出。

sentences.english: His breath smelled of ale and onions.
sentences.chinese: 他呼出的氣帶着麥酒和洋蔥的臭味。

sentences.english: He had reached the floor, his breath coming in searing gasps.
sentences.chinese: 他來到了地板上，他的呼出的氣息變得灼熱起來。

sentences.english: His breath steamed in the air, fogging the ice behind his head.
sentences.chinese: 他呼出的團團白氣，模糊了腦袋後面的冰牆。

sentences.english: Inhale deeply through your nose, then exhale quickly and forcibly, also through your nose (or pursed lips).
sentences.chinese: 用鼻深吸氣，然後用鼻或撅起嘴脣使勁並快速的呼出。

sentences.english: Our breath is misting up the car windows.
sentences.chinese: 我們呼出的氣漸漸給汽車的窗戶上蒙上一層水蒸氣。

sentences.english: They are more inclined to blow away the cobwebs than my contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 他們比我的同齡人更執著於去呼出自己的聲音。

sentences.english: Our breath gathers in clouds along the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 我們呼出的熱空氣聚集在墓頂。

sentences.english: The bacterium is spread by exhaled droplets.
sentences.chinese: 細菌通過呼出的飛沫傳播。

sentences.english: The doctor told me to breathe in deeply and then breathe out.
sentences.chinese: 醫生要我深深吸氣，然後把氣呼出來。

sentences.english: This is the result of the in-breath and out-breath of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 這是進化的吸入和呼出結果。

sentences.english: These foods contain oils that are transferred to the lungs and exhaled.
sentences.chinese: 這些食品中所含的油會轉移到肺中，然後被呼出來。

sentences.english: But no one can breathe out face to face the potion unwittingly taken in dreams.
sentences.chinese: 可是沒有人會面對面地呼出在夢中誤服的媚藥。

sentences.english: In the physical, plants inhale carbon dioxide and exhale oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 在物質形體，植物吸入二氧化碳而呼出氧氣。

definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
to breathe in/to suck in/to inhale
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
